Basic.name: Fiery War Axe
Basic.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

Basic.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
Basic.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

Basic.name: Wolfrider
Basic.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

Basic.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
Basic.flavor: Sen'jin Village is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

Basic.name: Water Elemental
Basic.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
Basic.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

Basic.name: Windspeaker
Basic.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

Basic.name: Assassin's Blade
Basic.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

Basic.name: Starving Buzzard
Basic.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

Classic.name: Dust Devil
Classic.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)
Classic.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

Classic.name: Flame Imp
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
Classic.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

Classic.name: Faerie Dragon
Classic.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Classic.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

Classic.name: Mad Bomber
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
Classic.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

Classic.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
Classic.text: Your spells cost (1) less.
Classic.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

Classic.name: Wild Pyromancer
Classic.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
Classic.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

Classic.name: Youthful Brewmaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
Classic.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

Classic.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
Classic.text: Battlecry: Change an_enemy minion's Attack to 1.
Classic.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

Classic.name: Blood Knight
Classic.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
Classic.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

Classic.name: Eaglehorn Bow
Classic.text: [x]Whenever a friendly\nSecret is revealed,\ngain +1 Durability.
Classic.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

Classic.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
Classic.text: Battlecry: Restore 3_Health.
Classic.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

Classic.name: Felguard
Classic.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
Classic.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

Classic.name: Laughing Sister
Classic.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

Classic.name: Mind Control Tech
Classic.text: [x]Battlecry: If your opponent\nhas 4 or more minions, take\n control of one at random.
Classic.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

Classic.name: Murloc Warleader
Classic.text: Your other Murlocs have +2 Attack.
Classic.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

Classic.name: Raging Worgen
Classic.text: Has +1 Attack and Windfury while damaged.
Classic.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

Classic.name: Scarlet Crusader
Classic.text: Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

Classic.name: SI:7 Agent
Classic.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
Classic.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

Classic.name: Southsea Captain
Classic.text: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.
Classic.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

Classic.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
Classic.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
Classic.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

Classic.name: Void Terror
Classic.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both\nadjacent minions and gain\n their Attack and Health.
Classic.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

Classic.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
Classic.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2_weapon.
Classic.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

Classic.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
Classic.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
Classic.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

Classic.name: Dread Corsair
Classic.text: Taunt\nCosts (1) less per Attack of_your weapon.
Classic.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

Classic.name: Ethereal Arcanist
Classic.text: If you control a Secret at_the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
Classic.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

Classic.name: Silvermoon Guardian
Classic.text: Divine Shield
Classic.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

Classic.name: Violet Teacher
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
Classic.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

Classic.name: Faceless Manipulator
Classic.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
Classic.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

Classic.name: Fen Creeper
Classic.text: Taunt
Classic.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

Classic.name: Stampeding Kodo
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
Classic.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

Classic.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
Classic.text: Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt, Windfury
Classic.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

Classic.name: Lord Jaraxxus
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
Classic.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

Naxxramas.name: Jaws
Naxxramas.text: Whenever a minion with Deathrattle dies, gain +2 Attack.

Naxxramas.name: Dark Cultist
Naxxramas.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3 Health.
Naxxramas.flavor: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Unrelenting Warrior
Naxxramas.text: Deathrattle: Summon a Spectral Warrior for your opponent.

Naxxramas.name: Voidcaller
Naxxramas.text: Deathrattle: Put a random Demon from your hand into the battlefield.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Wailing Soul
Naxxramas.flavor: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Sludge Belcher
Naxxramas.flavor: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Puddlestomper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Recombobulator
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shrinkmeister
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Gnomish Experimenter
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Metaltooth Leaper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Powermace
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Soot Spewer
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Spider Tank
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Tinkertown Technician
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Enhance-o Mechano
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield\n(at random).

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Fel Cannon
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Antique Healbot
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Blingtron 3000
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Bomb Lobber
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Gazlowe
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Toxitron
Blackrock Mountain.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Moira Bronzebeard
Blackrock Mountain.text: Thaurissan's Hero Power can't be used.\nNever attacks minions unless they have Taunt.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Dragonkin Sorcerer
Blackrock Mountain.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Fireguard Destroyer
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Grim Patron
Blackrock Mountain.text: After this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

The Grand Tournament.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.

The Grand Tournament.name: Fallen Hero
The Grand Tournament.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: And he can't get up.

The Grand Tournament.name: King's Elekk
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Elekk jousting is AWESOME.

The Grand Tournament.name: Sparring Partner
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Come at me, bro.

The Grand Tournament.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

The Grand Tournament.name: Totem Golem
The Grand Tournament.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

The Grand Tournament.name: Undercity Valiant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dragonhawk Rider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

The Grand Tournament.name: Eydis Darkbane
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: HATES being called "the wonder twins".

The Grand Tournament.name: Fjola Lightbane
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: LOVES being called "the wonder twins".

The Grand Tournament.name: King's Defender
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

The Grand Tournament.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

The Grand Tournament.name: Shadowfiend
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

The Grand Tournament.name: Silver Hand Regent
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

The Grand Tournament.name: Spellslinger
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

The Grand Tournament.name: Tuskarr Totemic
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dalaran Aspirant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

The Grand Tournament.name: Holy Champion
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

The Grand Tournament.name: Murloc Knight
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

The Grand Tournament.name: Refreshment Vendor
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

The Grand Tournament.name: Ram Wrangler
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a\nrandom Beast.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

The Grand Tournament.name: Shado-Pan Rider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

The Grand Tournament.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

The Grand Tournament.name: Bolf Ramshield
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

The Grand Tournament.name: Kodorider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

The Grand Tournament.name: Eadric the Pure
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

The League of Explorers.name: Huge Toad
The League of Explorers.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Fierce Monkey
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Mounted Raptor
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Unearthed Raptor
The League of Explorers.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Gain a copy of its_Deathrattle.
The League of Explorers.flavor: Still hunting for the ones who earthed him.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Elise Starseeker
The League of Explorers.text: Battlecry: Shuffle the 'Map to the Golden Monkey' into your deck.
The League of Explorers.flavor: A large part of her job entails not mixing up the Map to the Golden Monkey with the Map to Monkey Island.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Gorillabot A-3
The League of Explorers.text: Battlecry: If you control another Mech, Discover a Mech.
The League of Explorers.flavor: A-1 and A-2 went nuts, when they should have gone bolts.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Keeper of Uldaman
The League of Explorers.text: Battlecry: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.
The League of Explorers.flavor: U da man!  No, U da man!
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Tomb Spider
The League of Explorers.flavor: Less serious than its cousin, the Grave Spider.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Uldaman, in the League of Explorers adventure.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cult Sorcerer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Darkshire Librarian
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry:\nDiscard a random card. Deathrattle:\nDraw a card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Eternal Sentinel
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twisted Worgen
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Stealth
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Bloodsail Cultist
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: If you control another Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Rallying Blade
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Ravaging Ghoul
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: But goes by "Ravishing Ghoul" when he hits the club.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Silithid Swarmer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just "Silithid Loner".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Steward of Darkshire
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twilight Elder
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the end of your turn, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Aberrant Berserker
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Has +2 Attack while damaged.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: I berserk, therefore I am.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cyclopian Horror
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each enemy minion.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?'  Just how horrible do you have to be?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Fandral Staghelm
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Your Choose One cards and powers have both effects combined.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Hooded Acolyte
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever a character is healed, give your\nC'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Infested Wolf
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spiders.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Mire Keeper
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Choose One - Summon a\n2/2 Slime; or Gain an\nempty Mana Crystal.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" \n"No.  I'm keeping it."

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Crazed Worshipper
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt. Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Darkspeaker
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Psych-o-Tron
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt\nDivine Shield
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Pompous Thespian
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: Alas poor Annoy-o-Tron! A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy!
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Cloaked Huntress
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: She's practically GIVING your secrets away!
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Deadly Fork
One Night in Karazhan.text: Deathrattle: Add a 3/2 weapon to your hand.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: For a proper setting, place the deadly fork after the salad fork, but before the dinner fork.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Silverware Golem
One Night in Karazhan.text: If you discard this minion, summon it.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: From the secret research labs of the Swiss Army.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Zoobot
One Night in Karazhan.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly Beast, Dragon, and Murloc +1/+1.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: The Murloc is taking the picture.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Arcanosmith
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: He’s really just a Blacksmith, but he thought the fancy title would bring in more business.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Barnes
One Night in Karazhan.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of a random minion in your deck.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: He used to play every part, until Moroes confiscated his Orb of Deception.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Priest of the Feast
One Night in Karazhan.text: Whenever you cast a spell, restore 3 Health to\nyour hero.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: Now that's a world champion cheesecake!
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Wicked Witchdoctor
One Night in Karazhan.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random basic_Totem.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: You can easily defeat her by either dealing 4 damage, or dropping a house on her.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Avian Watcher
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: He mostly watches light romantic comedies.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Fool's Bane
One Night in Karazhan.text: Unlimited attacks each turn. Can't attack heroes.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: A fool and his bane are soon parted.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Onyx Bishop
One Night in Karazhan.text: Battlecry: Summon a friendly minion that died this game.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: B4 is a nice place to visit, but he wouldn't want to live there.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Book Wyrm
One Night in Karazhan.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack.
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: His favorites are classic tragedies like "The Hobbit" and "Grendel".
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

One Night in Karazhan.name: Moat Lurker
One Night in Karazhan.flavor: He really enjoys lurking and gets a lot of job satisfaction out of it.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
One Night in Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Trogg Beastrager
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Give a random Beast in your hand +1/+1.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Still angry that the Gadgetzan Rager Club wouldn't accept him as a member.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Auctionmaster Beardo
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: After you cast a spell, refresh your Hero Power.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Gadgetzan has always run an under-the-table auction house, and business has been PRETTY good for Beardo since the population explosion.  And since the explosion that destroyed the competing auction houses in the city.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Backstreet Leper
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Quit playing games with his heart. And his fingers. And foot. It's rude.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Celestial Dreamer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If you control a\nminion with 5 or more\nAttack, gain +2/+2.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: If you think her job is easy, YOU try falling asleep on cue.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Fel Orc Soulfiend
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to this_minion.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Doc says the persistent burning sensation in my soul is probably just an ulcer."

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Grimestreet Pawnbroker
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Give a random weapon in your hand +1/+1.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "I don't know a lot about used GvG cards, so I'm going to have to call in an expert."

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kabal Talonpriest
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Inkmaster Solia had to figure out how to tattoo feathers.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Manic Soulcaster
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Shuffle a copy into your deck.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: When casting a tournament, you really have to put your soul into it!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Shaky Zipgunner
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Deathrattle: Give a random\nminion in your hand +2/+2.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The Grimy Goons can get you any weapon you want but if you want it to not explode you gotta pay extra.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Daring Reporter
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Whenever your opponent draws a card, gain +1/+1.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: She's working on a story!  While skydiving!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Jinyu Waterspeaker
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Waterspeakers can tell the future! So the Jade Lotus employs them to speculate on the Auction House.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kabal Chemist
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Add a random Potion to your hand.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Sure you could have that Polymorph potion, but wouldn't you rather have this mystery potion?  It could be anything.  Even a Polymorph potion!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kazakus
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck\nhas no duplicates,\n_create a custom spell.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The mysterious leader of the Kabal is NOT a dragon, and does NOT deal in illegal potions.  Any public statements to the contrary will be met with litigation and Dragonfire Potions.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Lotus Illusionist
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]After this minion attacks\na hero, transform it into a\n_random 6-Cost minion.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: If you think her Illidan and Sylvanas cosplay is great, wait till you see her Reno Jackson!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Grook Fu Master
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Grook Fu, the ancient Hozen art of bashing heads with a stick.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Knuckles
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: After this attacks a\nminion, it also hits the enemy hero.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: When confronted with accusations of performance-enhancing bananas, Knuckles replied, "I get my fruit from trees I knock down with my bare hands like everyone else."

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Ancient of Blossoms
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: His new shampoo is really working!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Jade Behemoth
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Carnassa's Brood
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Crackling Razormaw
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Adapt a friendly_Beast.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Wasn't clever enough to go AROUND the electric fence.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Chittering Tunneler
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Discover a spell. Deal damage to your hero equal to its Cost.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Ear to the ground, he carefully interpreted the chittering noises: “You wanna cast a spell? I wanna cast a spell!”

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Curious Glimmerroot
Journey to Un'Goro.text: [x]Battlecry: Look at 3 cards. Guess which one started in your opponent's deck to get a copy of it.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: George promised to be good. But it's easy for little Glimmerroots to forget.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Eggnapper
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Raptors.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Often misunderstood, it's just that he likes to use the eggs as pillows.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Gluttonous Ooze
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and gain Armor equal to its Attack.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Three time winner of the Un'Goro weapon eating contest.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Primalfin Lookout
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: If you control another Murloc, Discover a_Murloc.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Lookout is a self-appointed title that's mostly an excuse to beat things up.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Terrorscale Stalker
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Trigger a friendly minion's Deathrattle.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Likes to scare his friends half to death.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Thunder Lizard
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: If you played an_Elemental last turn, Adapt.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: What? THUNDER LIZARD is adapting!

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Vicious Fledgling
Journey to Un'Goro.text: After this minion attacks a_hero, Adapt.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: A youngster who is truly hungry for self-improvement.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Bright-Eyed Scout
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. Change its Cost to (5).
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Also inordinately excited for cupcakes.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Fire Plume Phoenix
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: This is what happens when you use a volcano as a bird bath.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Lakkari Felhound
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Discard two random cards.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Guaranteed to track tar all over your carpet.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Lightfused Stegodon
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Adapt your Silver_Hand Recruits.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: “Come now, Johnston. I think those horns are quite fetching on you.”

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Obsidian Shard
Journey to Un'Goro.text: [x]Costs (1) less for each\ncard you've played from\nanother class.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: You know you’re a Rogue when a sharp rock makes you go “Ooh!  Dagger!”

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Shellshifter
Journey to Un'Goro.text: [x]Choose One - Transform\ninto a 5/3 with Stealth;\nor a 3/5 with Taunt.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Master of the Three Shell Monte.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Shellshifter
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Taunt

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Spiritsinger Umbra
Journey to Un'Goro.text: After you summon a minion, trigger its Deathrattle effect.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: She sees the fate of anyone she meets, but it's always the same: dinosaur attack.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: The Voraxx
Journey to Un'Goro.text:
[x]After you cast a spell on
this minion, summon a
1/1 Plant and cast
another copy on it.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: I am the Voraxx.  I speak for the weeds.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Tol'vir Stoneshaper
Journey to Un'Goro.text: [x]Battlecry: If you played an\nElemental last turn, gain\n_Taunt and Divine_Shield.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: He spends a lot of time keeping himself in stoneshape.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Direhorn Hatchling
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Taunt\nDeathrattle: Shuffle a 6/9 Direhorn with Taunt into your deck.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: His mom could beat up your mom.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Lyra the Sunshard
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a random Priest spell to your hand.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Arise, fair sun, and kill my envious foes. They don't have a legendary as beautiful as you.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Tol'vir Warden
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Battlecry: Draw two 1-Cost minions from your deck.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Ferocious in combat… and even more terrifying in pet battles.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Vilespine Slayer
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Combo: Destroy a minion.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: 'Cause slayers gonna slay, slay, slay, slay, slay.

Journey to Un'Goro.name: Sunkeeper Tarim
Journey to Un'Goro.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Set all other minions' Attack and Health to 3.
Journey to Un'Goro.flavor: Ironically, his favorite number is 4.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Eager Rogue
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Deals no damage while attacking.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Acolyte of Agony
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Lifesteal
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: It takes many years of practiced study in order to fully master agony.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Coldwraith
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Battlecry: If an enemy is Frozen, draw a card.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Doomed Apprentice
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Your opponent's spells cost (1) more.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: Jaina was never good at keeping up apprentices.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Ghoul
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Taunt

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Happy Ghoul
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Costs (0) if your hero was healed this turn.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Howlfiend
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, discard a_random card.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: The problem is that he carries those cards in his mouth.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Needy Hunter
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Whenever this minion attacks, add a Coin to your hand.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Prince Taldaram
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Battlecry: If your deck has_no 3-Cost cards, transform into a 3/3 copy of a minion.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to copy others.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Shadowblade
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Battlecry: Your hero is Immune this turn.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Shallow Gravedigger
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Deathrattle minion to your_hand.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: It's hard to put them six feet under when you're three feet tall.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Vryghoul
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: [x]Deathrattle: If it's your\nopponent's turn,\nsummon a 2/2 Ghoul.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: It's pronounced VERY GHOUL. Don't let anyone tell you different.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Chillblade Champion
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Charge\nLifesteal
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: It slices, it dices, it vaporizes! The Chillblade will make a Champion out of even the lowliest gnome.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Corpsetaker
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: [x]Battlecry: Gain Taunt if your deck has a Taunt minion. Repeat for Divine Shield, Lifesteal, Windfury.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: Her extensive collection of corpses includes one of nearly every type.  She'd love for you to join it.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Deathaxe Punisher
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Battlecry: Give a random Lifesteal minion in your hand +2/+2.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Festergut
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: At the end of your turn, deal 3 damage to all enemy minions.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Night Howler
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Whenever this minion takes\ndamage, gain +2 Attack.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: Honestly, he howls during the day, too.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Phantom Freebooter
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Battlecry: Gain stats equal to your weapon's.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: There's no such thing as a free boot.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Water Elemental
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Corpse Raiser
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: [x]Battlecry: Give a friendly\nminion "Deathrattle:\n Resummon this minion."
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: He was just minding his business, farming corpses, when you meddling adventurers came along.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Death Revenant
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each damaged minion.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: How's everyone doing? Hurt? Bleeding? Wounded? ... Excellent.

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Blackguard
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Whenever your hero is healed, deal that much damage to a random enemy minion.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: "Did I ever tell you the story of when I single-handedly took down a 29/29 C'thun?" - Reno Jackson

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Bryn'troll, the Bone Arbiter
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Windfury

Knights of the Frozen Throne.name: Hadronox
Knights of the Frozen Throne.text: Deathrattle: Summon your Taunt minions that\ndied this game.
Knights of the Frozen Throne.flavor: The viziers of Azjol-Nerub released Hadronox as a last-ditch effort to hold back the Lich King. They did so by VERY carefully scooping him up in a LARGE newspaper and releasing him.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Portable Ice Wall
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Taunt. Can't Attack.\n Freeze any character damaged by this_minion.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Cavern Shinyfinder
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: Draw a weapon from your deck.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: They call her the candled vandal.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Greedy Pickaxe
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: After your hero attacks, gain an empty Mana_Crystal.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Boisterous Bard
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions +1 Health.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: As a kid, she fought with rocks.  Now she fights with ROCK!

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Fungal Enchanter
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Qualifications: Born with pointy hat.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Gluttonous Trogg
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1/+1.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Greedy Sprite
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Deathrattle: Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Sparkliest of the seven deadly sprites.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Void Ripper
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: Swap the\nAttack and Health of all_other_minions.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: You had to put the portable hole inside the bag of holding, didn't you?!

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Astral Tiger
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle a\n copy of this minion into_your_deck.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Astral kitty litter is surprisingly hard to find.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Duskbreaker
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: If you're holding\na Dragon, deal 3 damage to all other minions.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Waking up at the break of dusk is just not as impressive.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Ebon Dragonsmith
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: Reduce the Cost of a random weapon in your hand by (2).
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Having a furnace-mouth is really handy for a blacksmith.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Elven Minstrel
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Combo: Draw 2 minions from your deck.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: "After that gig in Hamlin went south, I swore off rats."

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Ironwood Golem
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Taunt\nCan only attack if you have 3 or more Armor.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Marketed as a "rust-proof iron golem."

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Kobold Illusionist
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 copy of a minion from your hand.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: He can make ANYTHING look like a candle.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Kobold Monk
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Your hero can't be targeted by spells or Hero_Powers.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: There is no candle.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Shimmering Courser
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Only you can target\nthis with spells and\nHero Powers.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: A courser is a courser of course, of course, she's more of a unicorn than a horse...

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Green Jelly
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/2 Ooze with_Taunt.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: This card really breaks out of the mold.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Rin, the First Disciple
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Taunt\nDeathrattle: Add 'The First Seal' to your hand.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Signed and sealed, she delivers oblivion.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Silver Vanguard
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Deathrattle: Recruit an\n8-Cost minion.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Float like a Faerie Dragon, sting like a Hivequeen.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Grizzled Guardian
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Taunt\nDeathrattle: Recruit 2_minions that cost (4)_or_less.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Favorite sandwich? Grizzled cheese.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: The Runespear
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: After your hero attacks, Discover a spell\nand cast it with random targets.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: When asked what the runes do, the tauren smith smiled: "A little of this, a little of that..."

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Woecleaver
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: After your hero attacks, Recruit a minion.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Turn that frown into TWO frowns!

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Dragoncaller Alanna
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: Battlecry: Summon a 5/5 Dragon for each spell you cast this game that costs (5) or more.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Her secret is using a gentle voice and carrying a baggie of hotdogs.

Kobolds & Catacombs.name: Voidlord
Kobolds & Catacombs.text: [x]Taunt\n Deathrattle: Summon three\n1/3 Demons with Taunt.
Kobolds & Catacombs.flavor: Never let it hold your checkbook.

The Witchwood.name: Weeping Ghost
The Witchwood.text: Lifesteal

The Witchwood.name: Murloc Holmes
The Witchwood.text: Whenever your opponent draws a card, add a copy to your hand.

The Witchwood.name: Ritual Dagger
The Witchwood.text: [x]Lifesteal\nAfter you cast a spell, this\ngains +1 Durability.

The Witchwood.name: Black Cat
The Witchwood.text: Spell Damage +1\n Battlecry: If your deck has only odd-Cost cards, draw a card.
The Witchwood.flavor: She's so odd, you can't even.

The Witchwood.name: Blackwald Pixie
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: Refresh your Hero Power.
The Witchwood.flavor: "Oh hi bark."

The Witchwood.name: Blink Fox
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: Add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
The Witchwood.flavor: It's like, SUPER bad at staring contests.

The Witchwood.name: Gilnean Tracker
The Witchwood.text: [x]Rush\nAt the start of your turn,\ntransform this into a 5/5.

The Witchwood.name: Hench-Clan Thug
The Witchwood.text: After your hero attacks, give this minion +1/+1.
The Witchwood.flavor: Hard time making ends meet? Hate the League of Explorers? Get a job henching!

The Witchwood.name: Hunter of Old
The Witchwood.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain Spell Damage +2.

The Witchwood.name: Nightmare Amalgam
The Witchwood.text: [x]This is an Elemental, Mech,\nDemon, Murloc, Dragon,\nBeast, Pirate and Totem.
The Witchwood.flavor: Be all that you can be.

The Witchwood.name: Rabid Worgen
The Witchwood.text: Rush
The Witchwood.flavor: "I'm sorry, son.  We had to send Old Howler off…to a farm…to play…"

The Witchwood.name: Tanglefur Mystic
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: Add a random\n2-Cost minion to each player's hand.
The Witchwood.flavor: Doom!  Only doom for you!  But pay good tip, maybe less doom.

The Witchwood.name: Walnut Sprite
The Witchwood.text: Echo
The Witchwood.flavor: How do you make a walnut laugh? Crack it up!

The Witchwood.name: Bellringer Sentry
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
The Witchwood.flavor: "Who are you? Eh, none of my business."

The Witchwood.name: Blood Witch
The Witchwood.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1 damage to your_hero.
The Witchwood.flavor: Like a sloppy joe for vampires.

The Witchwood.name: Houndmaster Shaw
The Witchwood.text: Your other minions have\nRush.
The Witchwood.flavor: They’re good dogs, Tess.

The Witchwood.name: Infected Quillflinger
The Witchwood.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 1 damage to a random enemy minion.

The Witchwood.name: Lifedrinker
The Witchwood.text: [x]Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to\nthe enemy hero. Restore\n3 Health to your hero.
The Witchwood.flavor: In a pinch, he'll also settle for Holy Water: Zero.

The Witchwood.name: Mad Hatter
The Witchwood.text: [x]Battlecry: Randomly toss\n3 hats to other minions.\nEach hat gives +1/+1.
The Witchwood.flavor: He's entirely bonkers. All the best goblins are.

The Witchwood.name: Mistwraith
The Witchwood.text: Whenever you play an Echo_card, gain +1/+1.
The Witchwood.flavor: One little Mistwraith sitting in a tree. M-I-S-T-I-N-G.

The Witchwood.name: Night Prowler
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: If this is the only minion on the battlefield, gain +3/+3.
The Witchwood.flavor: Listen to the mew-sic of the night.

The Witchwood.name: Tuskarr Raider
The Witchwood.text: Rush\nAfter this minion attacks, fire your Cannons.

The Witchwood.name: Vex Crow
The Witchwood.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random\n2-Cost minion.
The Witchwood.flavor: As birds of ill omen, these crows often summon Doomsayers.

The Witchwood.name: Witchwood Piper
The Witchwood.text: [x]Battlecry: Draw the lowest\nCost minion from your deck.
The Witchwood.flavor: She rids villages of annoying pests, like rats and children.

The Witchwood.name: Carrion Drake
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: If a minion died this turn, gain Poisonous.
The Witchwood.flavor: Fits easily into overhead luggage bins.

The Witchwood.name: Duskfallen Aviana
The Witchwood.text: On each player's turn, the first card played costs (0).
The Witchwood.flavor: Someone called her "Tweety". She didn't take it well.

The Witchwood.name: Ghostly Charger
The Witchwood.text: Divine Shield\nRush
The Witchwood.flavor: Maybe we should have called him Ghostly Rusher.

The Witchwood.name: Witchwood Grizzly
The Witchwood.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Lose 1 Health for each card in your opponent's hand.
The Witchwood.flavor: You know what they say about people with big hands? Small bears.

The Witchwood.name: Glinda Crowskin
The Witchwood.text: Minions in your hand have_Echo.
The Witchwood.flavor:
Summon an unlimited* number of minions!**


*Six
**Wisps

The Witchwood.name: Azalina Soulthief
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: Replace your hand with a copy of your_opponent's.
The Witchwood.flavor: The cards are always golden on the other side.

The Witchwood.name: Blackhowl Gunspire
The Witchwood.text:
[x]Can't attack. Whenever
this minion takes damage,
deal 3 damage to a
random enemy.
The Witchwood.flavor: The upper windows used to be for aiming. Then we thought: "Hey! MORE cannons!"

The Witchwood.name: Wyrmguard
The Witchwood.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
The Witchwood.flavor: They think they're trusted guardians. Dragons think they're convenient snacks.

The Witchwood.name: Gilnean Royal Guard
The Witchwood.text: [x]Divine Shield, Rush\nEach turn this is in your hand,\nswap its Attack and Health.
The Witchwood.flavor: Admittedly, they kind of dropped the ball with Prince Liam.

The Witchwood.name: Silver Sword
The Witchwood.text: After your hero attacks, give your minions +1/+1.
The Witchwood.flavor: Silver’s malleability limits its utility as an edged weapon. On the other hand... SHINY!

Tavern Brawl.name: Knife Juggler
Tavern Brawl.text: [x]After you summon a\nminion, deal 1 damage\nto a random enemy.

Tavern Brawl.name: Dragonscale Warrior
Tavern Brawl.text: Whenever any player targets this minion with a spell, that player draws a card.

Tavern Brawl.name: OLDPvP Rogue
Tavern Brawl.text: Stealth\nRegain Stealth when PvP Rogue kills a minion.

Tavern Brawl.name: Gluth
Tavern Brawl.text: At the end of your turn, summon a random Undead.

Tavern Brawl.name: Party Crasher
Tavern Brawl.text: Taunt\nYou don't control how this minion attacks.

Tavern Brawl.name: Party Crasher
Tavern Brawl.text: Taunt\nYou don't control how this minion attacks.

Tavern Brawl.name: Intrepid Dragonstalker
Tavern Brawl.text: Whenever ANY player plays a card, gain +1/+1.

Tavern Brawl.name: Red Riding Hood
Tavern Brawl.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Enemies can't attack this turn.

Tavern Brawl.name: Romulo
Tavern Brawl.text: At the end of your turn, restore 3 health to your hero.

Taverns of Time.name: Stasis Elemental
Taverns of Time.text: Battlecry: Freeze a minion until this leaves the battlefield.

Credits.name: Jerry Mascho
Credits.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1 damage. If this card is golden, deal 1 damage at the end of your turn instead. THIS IS A HAN SOLO JOKE.

Credits.name: Cameron Chrisman
Credits.text: While this is in your hand, Golden cards cost (1) less.

Credits.name: Josh Durica
Credits.text: Battlecry: Implement a 'cool new card.' Deal 5 damage to this minion.

Credits.name: Tim Erskine
Credits.text: Whenever this minion destroys another minion, draw a card.

Credits.name: Walter Kong
Credits.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to each of 2 strategic targets.

Credits.name: Lorenzo Minaca
Credits.text: Inspire: Gain Barbarism, then swap this minion's Attack and Health.

Credits.name: Yong Woo
Credits.text: Your other minions have +3 Attack and Charge.

Credits.name: Matthew Grubb
Credits.text: Battlecry: Fill both \n sides of the board with Carrion Grubs.
